Articles.Content: Is there any way to change the number of steps in a tweakable's UI slider? I'm working on a set of "mass simulator" parts which would allow their mass to be adjusted by adding or removing ballast in the VAB/SPH. However, it seems that the UI slider is limited to having 10 steps, which is much too coarse for the parts to be of much use. I've found other tweakables having as many as 200 steps (thrust limiters on engines), but there doesn't seem to be any reference to this in their config files. Additionally, I've found references online to a property called "stepIncrement", but it seems like it's only accessible from plugins.

stepIncrement should be accessible with a plugin - but not through the config file (unless I've missed something). Question - if your making an adjustable mass - don't you need a plugin to actually do the change of mass?

Edit: just went and looked - I don't see a stepIncrement but the IncrementLarge and incrementSmall look promising.

Edited September 27, 2016 by wasml

KSP handles the mass change as it should, so that part works perfectly.

I've found a lot of references to incrementLarge and incrementSmall in relation to various plugins (especially procedural parts), and the syntax is pretty much what I was expecting: There's a MODULE block for the plugin, then a [various]_UIEditor block inside that. So right now my best guess for what I need to do is figure out which module a fuel tank uses (my guess is that it's just a "Part"), then figure out the UIEditor subclass that's used for propellant. So it seems like a good lead, thanks!
Apparently this is hardcoded into the game and I wasted a huge amount of time.
